title: Active Inference in Decision Making and Planning
description: Application of Active Inference to human and artificial decision making, planning, and problem solving.
learning_objectives: Apply Active Inference to decision-making problems
Design planning algorithms based on expected free energy
Analyze human decision making through Active Inference lens

content.overview: Active Inference provides a normative theory of decision making that explains how agents balance exploration and exploitation. It treats decision making as planning to minimize expected free energy over future time steps.

decision_making_framework.sequential_decision_making: Make decisions over multiple time steps
decision_making_framework.goal_achievement: Take actions to achieve desired outcomes
decision_making_framework.adaptive_behavior: Change strategies based on new information

exploration_exploitation_tradeoff.epistemic_value: Value of information and uncertainty reduction
exploration_exploitation_tradeoff.pragmatic_value: Value of immediate rewards and goal achievement
exploration_exploitation_tradeoff.adaptive_balance: Balance changes with experience and context
exploration_exploitation_tradeoff.individual_differences: Different exploration strategies for different agents

case_studies.name: Foraging Decisions
case_studies.description: Animal foraging for food in uncertain environments
case_studies.problem: Decide where and how long to search for food
case_studies.active_inference_solution: Plan paths that balance food acquisition with information about food locations
case_studies.human_analog: Human foraging in supermarkets or online shopping

case_studies.name: Career Planning
case_studies.problem: Choose career path with uncertain outcomes
case_studies.active_inference_solution: Explore different options to reduce uncertainty about fit and success

case_studies.name: Medical Diagnosis
case_studies.problem: Order tests to diagnose patient condition
case_studies.active_inference_solution: Select tests that maximize information about diagnosis

cognitive_biases.confirmation_bias: Seeking information that confirms existing beliefs
cognitive_biases.loss_aversion: Stronger preferences against losses than for gains
cognitive_biases.active_inference_explanation: Biases as suboptimal inference or prior beliefs

group_decision_making.social_influence: How others' decisions affect our own

applications_in_ai.reinforcement_learning: Active Inference as alternative to RL

interactive_exercises.description: Simulate optimal foraging with Active Inference
interactive_exercises.environment: Grid world with hidden food sources
interactive_exercises.task: Find food efficiently while learning environment

ethical_considerations.autonomy: Balance between agent autonomy and human oversight
ethical_considerations.fairness: Ensure equitable outcomes across different agents

future_directions.collaborative_decision_making: Joint decision making with other agents

common_misconceptions.clarification: Expected free energy includes both rewards and information
Exploration depends on context and preferences
One framework among many, with specific strengths
